alert.note: Alert for Custer; Garfield; Holt; Loup; Wheeler (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 11:06PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Loup, Garfield, southeastern Holt, northeastern Custer and Wheeler Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1105 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elyria, or 8 miles northwest of Ord, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burwell, Taylor, Sargent, Chambers, Bartlett, Comstock, Ericson, Amelia, Calamus Reservoir State Recreation Area, Virginia Smith Dam, Kent Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Carson Lake, Sunfish Lake, Homestead Knolls Campground, Four Corners, Nunda Shoal Campground, Goose Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Gables, Knievels Corner and Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 104 and 127. Highway 281 between mile markers 135 and 168. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds around Calamus Reservoir should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for central Nebraska.
